Can be perennial in some zones, although it is usually a self seeding annual.

41759.description_long: This shiitake log is made from red oak and stands about a foot high with a diameter of approximately 5 inches. It is pre-inoculated and will begin to friut spontaneously within 9 to 12 months after the initial inoculation date on the tag. You can also \shock\ it by following the instruction included with the log, and force it to begin fruiting sooner. It will produce several fruitings a year for several years. A great way to learn about growing mushrooms. Makes a great gift.

41760.description_long: 100 Chicken of the woods mushroom plug spawn and detailed instructions. Use to colonize stumps and logs, and produce gourmet mushrooms for many years. Chicken of the Woods mushrooms get their name because their grained, firm texture and taste have been compared to chicken. A true culinary delight. It takes 6 to 12 months to fully colonize a log before the first fruting, but will then fruit for several years. Recommended tree species; Aspen, Poplar, Cottonwood, Balsam Poplar, Hackberry, Mulberry, Willows, Birch , Tallow, Buckeye, Tree of Heaven. DO NOT grow on Walnut, Elm, Black Locust, Ash and Larch/Tamarac.

41853.description_long: Shiso also known as Perilla or Beefsteak plant is a nice addition to the herb garden. At one to three feet tall and only about one foot wide its complicated flavor could become a new favorite without needing too much space. It can also be grown as a microgreen. The flavor is somewhere between mint and basil with hints of anise and cinnamon. It can be used as a sushi wrap, as a garnish or in a fruit or green salad. The purple shiso is used in pickling to add a violet hue. Whether you choose the green or purple, this is a plant that lends itself to culinary creativity. Non-GMO. Full maturity in 60-85 Days. Microgreen harvest between 16 to 22 Days.

41863.description_long: Toona sinensis. Non-GMO. This fast growing deciduous tree, that makes a savory, exotic and unique microgreen. Yes, this is a tree, grown and harvested as a microgreen! Harvested just after the true leaves emerge, its wide serrated leaves are beautiful and the flavor potent and savory, very different from most other micros. The flavor is like roasted garlic with a hint of nuttiness.This microgreen is a perfect choice to accompany your favorite cut of red meat, a steak salad or a rare roast beef sandwich!

41869.description_long: Non-GMO medicinal herb and microgreens seeds. Acmella oleracea. AKA: Toothache Plant, Electric Daisy, Eyeball Plant, Peek-A-Boo, Electric Buttons. As a medicinal herb, paracress contains the analgesic spilanthol, used traditionally to numb tootaches. When grown as a microgreen it is completely surprising. A favorite among our staff and a unique standout in the micro family! Beginning with a green, zesty and tart citrus flavor, it leaves you with an effervescent, mild lingering numbing mouth feel (Spilanthol). Tongue buzz anyone? Use a light hand when seeding and let grow a bit larger for a bigger kick. The skies the limit on uses for this terrific plant! Approx 116,000 seeds / oz.

The ideal grow media for these kits is potting soil, loose coco coir or micro mat hydroponic confetti. Ideal for selling full grown trays to restaurants, natural food grocers and at farmer's markets. Note: Requires more water than normal tray as well as more consistent watering as the edges and the middle dry out quicker than the rest of the tray. Note: Since it dries out quicker than other trays, mold has a lower chance of thriving in your microgreens or wheatgrass.

42403.description_long: Brassica rapa Narinosa Group. Non-GMO. Red Tatsoi makes a lovely microgreen as well as a terrific full size cool season asian green. As a microgreen the cotyledons open green and change to a reddish purple on about day 4. It germinates quickly and is ready for harvest in 7 - 10 days. For the best color give cool temperatures. Outside in areas with a cool summer, plant in late spring in full sun. Red Tatsoi is a wonderful additional to the fall garden, overwintering in mild climates. Grow undercover for early spring harvests in cold winter areas.
